meanings.definition: The act of making something sharp or sharper.
meanings.sent1: His sharpening of the knife made it safe to use again.
meanings.sent2: I need to do some sharpening of my pencils before the test.
meanings.sent3: The sharpening of his wit was evident in his clever jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her sharpening of focus was like a laser beam cutting through distractions.
meanings.sent5: The sound of sharpening echoed through the workshop, signaling the start of work.

meanings.definition: The process of improving or enhancing a skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: Her sharpening of her writing skills led to better grades.
meanings.sent2: Practice is key to sharpening your basketball skills.
meanings.sent3: The sharpening of his cooking abilities turned him into a master chef.
meanings.sent4: The sharpening of her memory was like adding more RAM to a computer.
meanings.sent5: The constant sharpening of his negotiation skills made him a formidable opponent in business deals.
